comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Woodrow Wilson had a daughter Eleanor. Image # 3244338 [ www.gettyimages.com/Search/Search.aspx?contractUrl=1&... ] at Getty Images shows her and I think it's the same woman. Similar picture at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/cph.3c31915 She married William Gibbs McAdoo in the White House on May 7, 1914. See hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ggbain.15800 hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/cph.3b36415 suggests that the young woman looking at her behind the man in foreground) is her sister, Jessie

comment._content: Thanks for the information!  We'll add it to the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Date inscribed on the negative (in reverse) appears to be from 1913, which would make this a few months after Woodrow Wilson assumed the Presidency on March 4, 1913. (View large.) 

William Gibbs McAdoo, Wilson's Secretary of the Treasury, was widowed in 1912. In 1913 he began courting Eleanor, Wilson's youngest daughter, who accepted his proposal, even though at 50 he was 27 years older than she. Woodrow Wilson was not thrilled by the idea, but did not prevent the marriage. McAdoo and Eleanor were divorced in 1934.
